intro: Crotalaria paraguayensis, commonly known as Paraguay false flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is an erect annual herb that can grow up to 1 meter in height, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seed pods are cylindrical and contain several oblong seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional medicine.
